00013 //
00014 // OffsetAnnotationAnnotator
00015 //
00016 // 18 September 2005 -- mwb
00017 //
00018 // Reads a supplied offset annotation file and adds the annotations to
00019 // the parsed document.
00020 //
00021 
00022 // Format of the offset annotation file: 8-column, tab-delimited.
00023 // From left-to-right, those columns are: 
00024 //
00025 //   docno     : external document id corresponding to the document in
00026 //             : which the annotation occurs.
00027 //
00028 //   type      : TAG or ATTRIBUTE
00029 //
00030 //   id        : an id number for the annotation; each line should have a
00031 //             : unique id >= 1.
00032 //
00033 //   name      : for TAG, name or type of the annotation
00034 //             : for ATTRIBUTE, the attribute name, or key
00035 //
00036 //   start     : start and length define the annotation's extent;
00037 //   length    : meaningless for an ATTRIBUTE
00038 //
00039 //   value     : for TAG, an INT64
00040 //             : for ATTRIBUTE, a string that is the attribute's value
00041 //
00042 //   parentid  : for TAG, refers to the id number of another TAG to be
00043 //             : considered the parent of this one; this is how hierarchical
00044 //             : annotations can be expressed.
00045 //             : a TAG that has no parent has parentid = 0
00046 //             : for ATTRIBUTE, refers to the id number of a TAG to which
00047 //             : it belongs and from which it inherits its start and length.
00048 //             : *NOTE: the file must be sorted such that any line that uses 
00049 //             : a given id in this column must be *after* the line that 
00050 //             : uses that id in the id column.
00051 //
00052 //   debug     : ignored by the OffsetAnnotator; can contain any information
00053 //             : that is beneficial to a human reading the file
00054 
00055 // While the OffsetAnnotationAnnotator is transforming the
00056 // ParsedDocument, it will directly operate on the data structures
00057 // just as if it were the Parser, except that it adds annotations from
00058 // its file as opposed to from the original TokenizedDocument text.
00059 
00060 #ifndef INDRI_OFFSETANNOTATIONANNOTATOR_HPP
00061 #define INDRI_OFFSETANNOTATIONANNOTATOR_HPP
00062

00080   namespace parse {
00081 
00082     enum OffsetAnnotationIndexHint {
00083       OAHintDefault,
00084       OAHintOrderedAnnotations,
00085       OAHintSizeBuffers,
00086       OAHintNone
00087     };
00088 
00089     class OffsetAnnotationAnnotator : public Transformation {
00090 
00091     private:
00092 
00093       // structure to hold a read tag
00094       struct ReadAnnotationTag {
00095         char *docno;
00096         char *name;
00097         char *s_value;
00098         int type; // TAG = 1, ATTRIBUTE = 2
00099         UINT64 id;
00100         UINT64 i_value;
00101         UINT64 parent;
00102         int start;
00103         int length;
00104       };
00105 
00106       // 
00107       OffsetAnnotationIndexHint _indexHintType;
00108 
00109       // path to the offset annotation file
00110       std::string _offsetAnnotationsFile;
00111 
00112       // holds the size of the last allocation of the buffers
00113       // to see if we should re-size it
00114       int lastBufferAllocationSize;
00115 
00116       // Before the actual ParsedDocument is read in, we can not
00117       // convert byte extents from the .oa file to token extents.  The
00118       // TagExtents in this table have their begin and end values
00119       // expressed as byte extents, not token extents.
00120       indri::utility::HashTable<const char *,std::set<TagExtent*>*> *_annotations;
00121 
00122       // After a document's set of annotations has been converted
00123       // to token extents, we store the result in this table in case
00124       // someone asks for that same document's annotations again.
00125       indri::utility::HashTable<const char *,std::set<TagExtent*>*> *_converted_annotations;
00126 
00127       indri::utility::HashTable<UINT64,TagExtent*>          *_tag_id_map;
00128       indri::utility::HashTable<UINT64,AttributeValuePair*> *_attribute_id_map;
00129 
00130       // vector of stored buffers here to allow for
00131       // end cleanup of allocated char* structures
00132       std::vector<char *> *_buffers_allocated;
00133 
00134       bool _first_open;
00135 
00136       ObjectHandler<indri::api::ParsedDocument>* _handler;
00137       Conflater* _p_conflater;
00138 
00139       std::ifstream annotationFile;
00140                         int offsetAnnotationFileLine;
00141 
00142       
00143       const char *_getDocno( indri::api::ParsedDocument* document );
00144       TagExtent *_getTag( UINT64 id );
00145       AttributeValuePair *_getAttribute( UINT64 id );
00146       bool _is_unique_id( UINT64 id, int line );
00147       UINT64 parse_UINT64( const char *str, int n );
00148       void _cleanup();
00149 
00150       ReadAnnotationTag parseLine(char *readLine, int lineCounter);
00151 
00152                         // holds the last annotation tag that was read and parsed
00153                         // (used for ordererd file parsing)
00154                         ReadAnnotationTag lastReadTag;
00155 
00156                         // reads in the tags for a document - used for ordered file parsing
00157                         void readAnnotationTags(const char *docno);
00158 
00159       void convert_annotations( std::set<indri::parse::TagExtent*>* raw_tags,
00160                                 std::set<indri::parse::TagExtent*>* converted_tags, 
00161                                 indri::api::ParsedDocument* document );
00162 
00163     public:
00165       OffsetAnnotationAnnotator( Conflater* p_conflater );
00166       OffsetAnnotationAnnotator();
00167       ~OffsetAnnotationAnnotator();

00169       void setTags (const char *docno, const std::vector<indri::parse::TagExtent *> &tagset);
00170       
00171       void setConflater(Conflater* p_conflater);

00174

00180     };
